items.title: How I turned Android 16â€™s Quick Settings into my smart home control center
items.summary: Google Home doesn't have this, but I found a very complicated workaround.
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority Android 16â€™s first major update made me fall back in love with Quick Settings. After Android 12 took away the smaller toggles and switched to the large pill-shaped buttons in the name of Material You, I started using Quick Settings less and less. See, any time a button is hidden away from my eyes and requires more than one or two swipes or taps, I just forget it exists. And this is what happened for me with Quick Settings on Android 12 to 15; I set up the ones I used the most up front and forgot about the rest. Android 16 QPR1 brought the ability to collapse each large pill into half its size and thus fit more toggles on one screen, and thatâ€™s what I immediately did. I now had more space to try new things with Quick Settings, like launch apps or start actions inside apps, but I blanked out for a while, not finding the right way to use the extra space. That is, until I realized that the action I needed the most is to control my smart home in general, and my standing desk in particular.

items.title: 4 ways Iâ€™m using AI tools to help me with my hobbies
items.summary: AI assistants don't have to be all work and no play.
items.body: Over the past few weeks, Iâ€™ve started making an effort to get back into my hobbies. Some of my favorite things to do include gardening and restoring or refurbishing furniture. But since it has been a while since I last did these activities, Iâ€™ve enlisted the help of AI to make things a bit easier for me â€” and Iâ€™ve actually been surprised by all the useful ways Iâ€™ve been able to use it.

items.title: Did you know: Samsung phones arenâ€™t made where you think
items.summary: Whatâ€™s more, Samsung also doesnâ€™t make all of its phones.
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority Youâ€™d imagine that the majority of Samsung phones would be made in the companyâ€™s home country of South Korea, but youâ€™d be wrong. The second guess would be China, since the country is known as the â€œworldâ€™s factoryâ€ and specializes in smartphone manufacturing, but thatâ€™s also not correct. Donâ€™t get me wrong, Samsung phones are made in both of these countries, but the devil is in the details. Samsung focuses on high-end phones in one and low-end models in the other, and it doesnâ€™t even own the manufacturing facilities in one of these countries. But Iâ€™m getting ahead of myself here â€” letâ€™s first talk about what makes Samsung special when it comes to smartphone making.

items.title: ReMarkable thinks this is the year your planner actually works
items.summary: The focus-first tablets now feature refreshed planning templates and bundle prices for 2026.
items.body: TL;DR ReMarkable has refreshed its planning templates for all devices ahead of 2026. The company is offering $70 off all reMarkable 2 bundles from January 4 through 17. The discount matches reMarkableâ€™s Black Friday deal, and has some users speculating about a new launch. ReMarkable is kicking off 2026 with usersâ€™ best intentions in mind, releasing updated planning templates for all reMarkable devices. The refresh includes new calendars, weekly planners, and to-do layouts, or in other words, everything you need to write down and attempt to keep your resolutions. As always, the updates align with reMarkableâ€™s distraction-free, focused philosophy, which may appeal to anyone hoping this is the year their planning system actually sticks.

items.title: Paul's jaw broken in two places by Joshua
items.summary: Jake Paul's jaw is broken in two places by Anthony Joshua during their heavyweight fight in Miami.

items.title: 'Oh no, what's he done?' - Brook bowled after reverse-sweep attempt
items.summary: Nathan Lyon bowls Harry Brook for 30 runs after the England batter's attempt at a reverse sweep is missed, leaving England on 177-4 on day four of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: With smartphone prices set to increase significantly, the realme 16 Pro series is the value pick in 2026
items.summary: The realme 16 Pro series is the value pick to keep your eye on.
items.body: An IDC report says the smartphone market is expected to decline by 0.9% in 2026, in part due to memory shortages and surging component prices. According to IDC, the average smartphone selling price is expected to rise to $465 in 2026, up from $457 in 2025. Memory and other component price fluctuations arenâ€™t new. But the ongoing memory price surge is set to cause an upheaval, with entry-level and budget-friendly Android smartphones likely to bear the brunt of the fallout. Memory prices are likely to rise 30% this quarter, and another 20% more early next year, on top of 50% price increases weâ€™ve already seen this year, according to Counterpoint Research .

items.title: Mancini, sibling rivalry and wanting to excite fans - the Yaya Toure story

items.title: Joshua stops Paul in sixth round of Miami mismatch
items.summary: British heavyweight Anthony Joshua needs six rounds to stop boxing novice Jake Paul, who spends much of the contest in survival mode.

items.title: 'Absolutely sensational' Labuschagne catch removes Pope
items.summary: Marnus Labuschagne reacts sharply to take a brilliant diving catch at second slip to dismiss Ollie Pope for 17, as England fall to 31-2 on day four of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: 'He could have left that' - Duckett dismissed early
items.summary: Pat Cummins draws an edge from Ben Duckett as the England batter is caught at second slip by Marnus Labuschagne for four, as the visitors lose their first wicket in the second over of the innings on day four of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: Head's 'wonderful' innings edges Australia closer to Ashes victory
items.summary: In front of his home crowd, Travis Head scores 170 to edge Australia closer to retaining the Ashes.

items.title: Carse takes two wickets in two balls
items.summary: Brydon Carse takes the wickets of Pat Cummins and Nathan Lyon in consecutive deliveries as Australia fall to 344-9 on day four of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

NASAâ€™s Mars Perseverance rover acquired this image on Dec. 5, 2025 (Sol 1704) at the local mean solar time of 12:33:53, using its onboard Left Navigation Camera (Navcam). The camera is located high on the roverâ€™s mast and aids in driving. NASA/JPL-Caltech Written by Noah Martin, Ph.D. student and Candice Bedford, Research Scientist at Purdue University While much of Perseveranceâ€™s work focuses on ancient rocks that record Marsâ€™ long-lost rivers and lakes, megaripples offer a rare opportunity to examine processes that are still shaping the surface today. Megaripples are sand ripples up to 2 meters (about 6.5 fâ€¦

items.title: Samsungâ€™s Galaxy Z Flip could be Exynos-only for the second straight year
items.summary: Samsung is rumored to use the in-house Exynos 2600 to power the Galaxy Z Flip 8.
items.body: TL;DR Samsung is reportedly exploring chip options for the Galaxy Z Flip 8, and the newly-announced Exynos 2600 is the leading contender. The companyâ€™s brand-new Exynos 2600 is the worldâ€™s first 2nm smartphone chip, which brings major performance increases compared to the Exynos 2500. If Samsung uses the Exynos 2600 for the Galaxy Z Flip 8, it would be the second straight year a Galaxy flip phone used an in-house processor. Samsungâ€™s next in-house flagship mobile processor, the Exynos 2600 , was just officially announced as the worldâ€™s first smartphone chip built using the 2nm Gate-All-Around (GAA) manufacturing process. Itâ€™s rumored to be powering select Samsung Galaxy S26 models in some global markets, but there may be another upcoming Samsung flagship using the chip. The Samsung Exynos 2600 might also power the Galaxy Z Flip 8, according to a new report. As reported by The Bell , Samsung could use the Exynos 2600 chip in the Galaxy Z Flip 8, which is set to arrive next summer (via 9to5Google ). The report cites unnamed industry sources, and says that Samsung is considering the Exynos 2600 for its next flip phone â€” nothing has been decided yet.

items.title: Google may get much more chatty when you do a search from your Pixel home screen
items.summary: This might be the first voice-based response to song searches that we've seen from Google.
items.body: TL;DR Google appears to be considering a change to how it responds to certain queries from the Pixel home screen widget. With both song searches and voice input, weâ€™re able to get responses from Google that contain voice output. Weâ€™re also seeing a new floating button for continuing your search in AI Mode. Google gives us a ton of different ways to look up information, and the form in which it delivers those results can vary a lot based on how we choose to interact with it â€” type a text search in your browser, and you get your results back as text. Use voice input for Gemini , and you get a voice response. But sometimes that doesnâ€™t always work the way weâ€™d expect, and today weâ€™re checking out what could be some upcoming changes to how Google communicates with us in response to using its Pixel home screen widget . items.title: NASA Shares SpaceX Crew-12 Assignments for Space Station Mission
items.summary: As part of NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-12 mission, four crew members from three space agencies will launch no earlier than Sunday, Feb. 15, 2026, to the International Space Station for a long-duration science expedition. NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway will serve as spacecraft commander and pâ€¦
items.body: From left to right, NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway, ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev. Credit: NASA As part of NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-12 mission, four crew members from three space agencies will launch no earlier than Sunday, Feb. 15, 2026, to the International Space Station for a long-duration science expedition. NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway will serve as spacecraft commander and pilot, respectively, and will be accompanied by ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev, who will both serve as mission specialists. Crew-12 will join Expedition 74 crew members currently aboard the space station. The flight is the 12th crew rotation with SpaceX to the orbiting laboratory as part of NASAâ€™s Commercial Crew Program . Crew-12 will conduct scientific investigations and technology demonstrations to help prepare humans for future exploration missions to the Moon and Mars, as well as benefit people on Earth. This will be the second flight to the space station for Meir, who was selected as a NASA astronaut in 2013. The Caribou, Maine, native earned a bachelorâ€¦

items.title: NASA Johnsonâ€™s 2025 Milestones
items.summary: NASAâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston closed 2025 with major progress across human spaceflight, research, and exploration. From Artemis II mission preparations to science aboard the International Space Station, teams at Johnson helped prepare for future missions to the Moon and, ultimately, Mars. â€¦
items.body: NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston closed 2025 with major progress across human spaceflight, research, and exploration. From Artemis II mission preparations to science aboard the International Space Station, teams at Johnson helped prepare for future missions to the Moon and, ultimately, Mars. Orion Stacked for Artemis II, Orion Mission Evaluation Room Unveiled   NASAâ€™s Artemis II Orion spacecraft with its launch abort system is stacked atop the agencyâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket in High Bay 3 of the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Oct. 20, 2025. NASA/Kim Shiflett As NASA prepares for the crewed Artemis II mission , a 10-day journey around the Moon and back in early 2026, teams at Johnson continue work to ensure the Orion spacecraft is flight-ready. The mission will carry NASA astronauts Reid Wiseman, Victor Glover, Christina Koch, and CSA (Canadian Space Agency) astronaut Jeremy Hansen.  In October, NASA completed stacking of the Orion spacecraft and launch abort system atop the agencyâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket inside the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. Following Orion â€¦

items.title: Googleâ€™s no longer going to force everyone off Assistant by the end of the year
items.summary: Assistant's mobile sunset gets delayed as Google reshapes the Gemini transition timeline.
items.body: TL;DR Back in March, Google announced that it would move Assistant users on mobile devices to Gemini, no longer giving them the option to stick with Assistant by the end of 2025. Google is now relaxing the deadline, and instead says that transition will continue as we move into 2026. Right now, Google Home users are starting to experience the transition to Gemini , but for all our mobile devices, the ball got rolling on the big Gemini switch months and months ago. Back in March, Google announced its plans to replace Assistant on nearly all Android phones with Gemini by the end of 2025. With the year now rapidly drawing to a close, Googleâ€™s got an update on those plans for us. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Water Droplet Science
items.summary: NASA astronaut Don Pettit demonstrates electrostatic forces using charged water droplets and a knitting needle made of Teflon. This series of overlapping frames from Feb. 19, 2025, displays the unique attraction-repulsion properties of Teflon and charged droplets, similar to how charged particles fâ€¦
items.body: NASA/Don Pettit NASA astronaut Don Pettit demonstrates electrostatic forces using charged water droplets and a knitting needle made of Teflon. This series of overlapping frames from Feb. 19, 2025, displays the unique attraction-repulsion properties of Teflon and charged droplets, similar to how charged particles from the Sun behave when they come in contact with Earthâ€™s magnetic field. Highly energetic particles from space that collide with atoms and molecules in the atmosphere create the  aurora borealis . Explore more of what Pettit has coined â€œscience of opportunity.â€ Image credit: NASA/Don Pettit

items.title: Sick of fake AI movie trailers on YouTube? Thereâ€™s good news
items.summary: Two large AI movie trailer channels have been taken down.
items.body: TL;DR Two large YouTube channels that primarily published bootleg AI movie trailers have been banned. Screen Culture and HK Studio have been deplatformed for violating YouTubeâ€™s policies about spam and metadata accuracy. Together, videos by the two channels had been viewed more than a billion times. Plenty of AI content has found a home on YouTube : fire up a fresh account, and youâ€™ll be seeing gen-AI videos within just a few rounds of recommendations. AI video in general is allowed on YouTube, of course, but some of it does run afoul of YouTubeâ€™s policies â€” and now, two major offenders have been booted from the platform. Deadline reports that YouTube has banned two large channels that had been peddling AI-generated movie trailers. The problem wasnâ€™t the trailers themselves, but how they were presented: YouTube channels Screen Culture and KH Studio had been uploading a large quantity of AI movie trailers that werenâ€™t clearly labeled, which YouTube says violates the platformâ€™s policies on spam and misleading metadata.

items.title: One of the last annoying side effects of the YouTubeâ€“Disney row is now fixed
items.summary: Movies Anywhere has fixed its Google syncing issue, but you'll have to take these steps to reconnect your account.
items.body: Credit: Movies Anywhere TL;DR Movies Anywhere is once again syncing purchases from Google Play and YouTube after being disabled during YouTube TV and Disneyâ€™s dispute. Syncing wonâ€™t resume automatically â€” you need to reconnect your Google account to Movies Anywhere to restore it. The fix closes the last major fallout from the feud, which had already been resolved elsewhere weeks ago. If you use Movies Anywhere to keep your movie purchases in one place, thereâ€™s some low-key good news to end the week. After disappearing during YouTube TV and Disneyâ€™s contract spat , syncing for Google Play and YouTube purchases is finally working again. As reported by 9to5Google , Google Play and YouTube have now been restored as Movies Anywhere partners. Disney owns Movies Anywhere, and the service dropped Google support during the dispute, resulting in a break in cross-platform syncing. Now that Google has been reinstated, things are mostly back to normal. You just have to take one extra step.

items.title: This streaming service will hit premium users with ads as soon as they open the app
items.summary: The only way to avoid ads is to pay even more money for the ad-free tier.
items.body: TL;DR Peacockâ€™s lower-tier Premium plan will begin showing â€œArrival Adsâ€ that appear immediately when the app is opened. Peacock is also using AI to deliver ads at key moments during live sports broadcasts. To avoid this increasing ad load, users must pay for the higher-priced Premium Plus subscription. NBCUniversalâ€™s streaming video service, Peacock, offers two tiers of subscriptions. After its steepest price hike a few months ago, the ad-supported Premium tier costs $10.99 per month, while you will have to shell out $16.99 per month for the ad-free Premium Plus tier. As if the existing ads in the Premium tier werenâ€™t enough, Peacock has the bright idea to add even more ads to the Premium tier â€” this time, showing ads right when the app starts up. items.summary: Lenovo is exploring alternatives to Windows, prompted by its limitations on gaming handhelds.
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR Lenovo might release a new variant of its Legion Go 2 gaming handheld. Instead of Windows 11 or an ROG Ally-style Xbox interface, this Legion Go 2 version is expected to run SteamOS. SteamOS is likely to improve usersâ€™ experience with better power management and a console-like interface. The Lenovo Legion Go 2 gaming handheld was first showcased at the CES 2025 conference, but it didnâ€™t make it to the market as late as the October. So, an upgraded version makes little sense. However, Lenovo may be looking to expand options for potential buyers by offering another variant that runs SteamOS instead of Windows. As per a recent leak, Lenovo may be gearing up to reveal this new variant of the Legion Go 2 at CES 2026, exactly a year after the first reveal. Windows Latest says the step to introduce a new variant stems from the unoptimized Windows experience on the small screen. While Lenovo had the option to choose the Xbox full-screen experience (FSE) , as did with the 2025 variants of ASUS ROG Ally and Ally X. However, it appears to have gone with SteamOS for its advantages, including lower hardware requirements, better power management,â€¦

items.title: YouTube is changing how the Dislike button works on Shorts
items.summary: YouTube is still fine-tuning how negative feedback works on its short-form feed.
items.body: Credit: Joe Hindy / Android Authority TL;DR YouTube is testing a merged thumbs-down option on Shorts that combines â€œDislikeâ€ and â€œNot interested.â€ The new thumbs-down button is being moved behind the three-dot menu for the test. YouTube says the change is meant to make it more straightforward to tune Shorts recommendations. Along with almost every other element of the platform, YouTube has been tinkering with how feedback works on Shorts for a while. The experimenting continues, and some viewers are about to see another switch-up. This time, YouTube is testing a new take on the Dislike button that affects both its placement and exact meaning. In a post on the Google Support forums , YouTube says itâ€™s experimenting with folding â€œDislikeâ€ and â€œNot interestedâ€ into a single thumbs-down option for Shorts. Rather than sitting on the main video UI, the button will now be tucked away behind the three-dot menu. Depending on the test group, it may appear as â€œDislikeâ€ or â€œNot interested,â€ but the action itself remains the same.

items.title: I tried to melt my OnePlus 15 with some real games
items.summary: To find out if it's as good as OnePlus claims.
items.body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority Ever since I heard about the OnePlus 15 , I was sure of one thing â€” even without using the phone: while it might fall short of a true upgrade to the OnePlus 13 , it would be excellent for gaming . It had to be, owing to the Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5â€™s improved architecture , OnePlusâ€™ abiding emphasis on internal cooling tech, the new highly responsive 165Hz display, and the brandâ€™s general fidelity to users who expect more than just the basics from their phones. But my colleaguesâ€™ initial reactions to the phone shook that conviction. In their initial testing, my colleague Robert Triggs found the new phone running at nearly scorching temperatures . Thatâ€™s a good thing if youâ€™re near the North Pole, helping Santa pack gifts for kids. But for the rest of us mere mortals, those temperatures â€” Iâ€™m talking about nearly 53Â°C (127Â°F) on the surface, were bothersome, and especially harrowing for mobile gamers who intend to use it for several dozen minutes, if not hours, holding the phone in their hands while fragging foes in leading FPS games.

The issue predominantly affects phones in the Pixel 7, 8, and 9 series across the stable and beta channels, though a few Samsung users are affected too. The issue has apparently existed for over a year, and Google has acknowledged it, but hasnâ€™t fixed it. The Google Pixel devices are intended to be a role model for the ideal Android experience. Ironically, however, these devices, including the premium ones, suffer from far more bugs than most other popular Android devices. While most of them, thankfully, get fixed in a matter of weeks , there has been one protracted bug that hasnâ€™t been resolved in over a year. And itâ€™s driving people up the wall. For months now, owners of several Google Pixel phones have been experiencing issues connecting to the head unit in their cars. According to several reports, Pixel phones donâ€™t automatically connect to the carâ€™s units immediately and require users to do it manually. items.title: Is that video fake? Geminiâ€™s new update aims to solve the AI slop problem
items.summary: By scanning audio and visual tracks, Googleâ€™s AI assistant can now pinpoint exactly where SynthID watermark is detected.
items.body: TL;DR Google has expanded Geminiâ€™s detection capabilities, enabling users to upload videos to verify whether they were created or edited using Google AI. Gemini scans audio and visual tracks within the video for imperceptible SynthID watermarks, identifying specific segments of AI-generated content. While available globally for files up to 100MB, the tool only detects SynthID, meaning it cannot identify AI media from many other AI tools. AI slop has been the big trend of 2025. Wherever you look on the internet, there are AI-generated images and videos. AI tools have also become so good that it has become significantly challenging to distinguish a real photo or video from an AI-generated one. Google has recently introduced the ability to detect AI-generated images within the Gemini app , and the company is now expanding this capability to detect AI-generated videos as well. items.title: Moon Mascot: NASA Artemis II ZGI Design Challenge
items.summary: Whose Moon Mascot design will join the Artemis II astronauts on their historic voyage around the Moon in early 2026? Between March 7 and Jun. 16, 2025, NASA worked with crowdsourcing company Freelancer to seek design ideas from global creators for a zero gravity indicator that will fly aboard the aâ€¦
items.body: 4 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) A graphic for the Moon Mascot: NASA Artemis II ZGI Design Challenge. Freelancer Whose Moon Mascot design will join the Artemis II astronauts on their historic voyage around the Moon in early 2026? Between March 7 and Jun. 16, 2025, NASA worked with crowdsourcing company Freelancer to seek design ideas from global creators for a zero gravity indicator that will fly aboard the agencyâ€™s Artemis II test flight. Zero gravity indicators are small, plush items carried aboard spacecraft to provide a visual indication of when the spacecraft and its crew reach space. For the first eight minutes after liftoff, the crew and their indicator nearby will still be pushed into their seats by gravity, and the force of the climb into space. When the main engines of the SLS (Space Launch System) rocketâ€™s core stage cut off, gravityâ€™s restraints are lifted, but the crew will still be strapped safely into their seats â€“ their zero gravity indicatorâ€™s ability to float will provide proof that theyâ€™ve made it into space. Artemis II marks the first time that the public has had a hand in creating a crewâ€™s mascot. The Mission Overâ€¦

Google now shares that access is spreading to Canada, including French support arriving next year. Gemini has finally landed on Google Home in full force â€” for some of us, anyway. While the big change from Assistant to Gemini has proved incredibly controversial, with plenty of users complaining about feature downgrades , that doesnâ€™t seem to be hurting how many people are still interested in giving it a try for themselves. Earlier this month, Google started seriously speeding up access to Home users in the US who wanted to switch to Gemini, and now weâ€™re finally getting some details on where Geminiâ€™s going next. Today Androidify for Wear OS formally launches, letting you make your own personalized watch faces. For all the fantastic tools Google builds to help organize, simplify, and just improve our day-to-day lives , sometimes itâ€™s the silly ones that we end up caring about most. And why not? items.title: Android 16 QPR3 introduces over 160 new emoji: Hereâ€™s every single one of them
items.summary: The next quarterly Android update will support the 163 new emoji from the Unicode 17.0 release.
items.body: TL;DR Android 16 QPR3 is set to introduce support for the newly released Unicode 17.0 standard and its emoji. The update includes 163 new characters, featuring additions like a distorted face, fight cloud, and orca. You can view these new emoji right now if you install the Android 16 QPR3 Beta 1 on a compatible Pixel. Emoji play a core role in how people communicate online, allowing us to express ourselves with playful images and symbols rather than just text. New emoji arrive each year to expand our expressive range, and to ensure they appear correctly on everyoneâ€™s device, regardless of the platform, they are codified in the Unicode standard. The latest version â€” Unicode 17.0 â€” dropped on September 9, 2025, introducing over 160 new characters. While the stable release of Android doesnâ€™t support them yet, that is set to change with next yearâ€™s third quarterly release of Android 16 . Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: This Qi2 power bank for your Pixel 10 wonâ€™t burst into flames
items.summary: That's a plus.
items.body: TL;DR BMX is opening general sales of its solid-state battery packs. As opposed to conventional lithium-ion batteries, solid-state components are far more resistant to fire. Magnetic Qi2 support lets you attach a BMX pack right to the back of your Pixel 10 phone. Weâ€™ve all seen the videos: Usually it starts with an impact â€” maybe someoneâ€™s at the gym and accidentally drops a weight on their phone. After that, a moment of calm â€” maybe everythingâ€™s fine? Thereâ€™s a chance theyâ€™ll just need a new screen protector, right? And then the smoke starts . Seconds later, itâ€™s billowing everywhere. Batteries donâ€™t have to be so dangerous, though, and BMX (Better Mobile Xperience) is now finally starting sales of its fire-resistant solid-state battery packs. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Ouraâ€™s Year in Review confirms just how stressed all of us are
items.summary: Users in the US log more than two hours of stress per day, on average.
items.body: TL;DR Year in Review is now available for Oura users. Oura users in Ireland logged the most steps in 2025 with an average of 8,924 per day. Austrailian users had the highest average sleep score (80/100). Users in the US logged the most daily stress on average, at 121.2 minutes. The year is drawing to a close, and on the back of Spotify Wrapped , every app youâ€™ve ever used has some kind of year-end recap to offer. Next up: Oura users now have access to Ouraâ€™s personalized, annual Year in Review recaps that show trends in activity, sleep, and more. Ouraâ€™s also shared the countries where its users are logging the most activity, sleep, and stress â€” and itâ€™s not looking great for the US. According to Oura, users living in New Zealand had the highest average sleep score for 2025, at 80 out of 100. Australia came in a close second at 79.4, with Denmark and Austria tied for third place at 79. Oura wearers in Ireland got the most steps per day at an average of 8,924. Second and third place were close: users in Spain got an average of 8,914 steps a day, while those in Italy logged 8,907 on average.

items.title: Is your Pixel getting Googleâ€™s surprise December update? Hereâ€™s every supported phone
items.summary: Happy holidays! Google has another Pixel update for you.
items.body: If youâ€™re a Pixel user, youâ€™re probably used to Googleâ€™s steady stream of software updates. In addition to major Android OS upgrades, the company releases monthly security patches. Typically, thereâ€™s just one security update per month, but December has suddenly given us two. Following the main December update released at the beginning of the month, Google launched a second update on December 17. Itâ€™s a minor update, including reduced battery drain and a fix for a touch responsiveness bug specific to the Pixel 10, but an update is still an update â€” no matter how small.

items.title: ANBERNICâ€™s Game Boy-style handheld finally gets a launch date â€” and itâ€™s very soon

Sales begin on December 20, with prices rising after 72 hours. The RG 477V will be available in 8GB/128GB and 12GB/256GB configurations. ANBERNICâ€™s largest and most powerful Game Boy-style handheld is almost here. After weeks of leaks , teasers, and spec confirmations , we finally have official pricing and a concrete sales date for the RG 477V. According to the product listing now live on ANBERNICâ€™s website , sales for the RG 477V will begin on December 20, with an early-bird discount available for the first 72 hours. During that window, the base 8GB RAM + 128GB storage model will cost $199.99, down from a listed regular price of $219.99. The higher-end 12GB RAM + 256GB storage version will be priced at $239.99, discounted from $259.99.

However, one of the most significant upgrades on the way appears to be 60W wired charging for the Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra . Iâ€™m certainly not complaining; thatâ€™s obviously a nice upgrade that will make the phone a little bit snappier to charâ€¦

items.title: Turning off Nothingâ€™s Lock Glimpse feature might actually make things worse
items.summary: Nothingâ€™s Lock Glimpse still runs when disabled, with users flagging background activity that could hurt battery life.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Lock Glimpse debuted in Nothing OS 4.0 as an optional lock screen feature, but it is now raising concerns over battery drain. Itâ€™s a system-level component, meaning it canâ€™t be uninstalled without root access and can only be toggled off. Even when disabled, the system reportedly attempts to restart Lock Glimpse every few seconds, resulting in unnecessary background activity. Nothingâ€™s latest software experiment is turning into an unexpected headache, and itâ€™s testing the patience of some of the brandâ€™s loyal fans. The trouble is with Lock Glimpse, a lock-screen feature in Nothing OS 4.0 , which started as an optional addition but is now sparking real concern about battery life. Lock Glimpse first appeared in beta builds of Nothing OS 4.0 . On paper, it sounds harmless enough. Nothing frames it as a discovery-focused lock screen experience. You wake your phone and see rotating images paired with short headlines, each linking out to a web article. The pitch is that it adds variety and context. The reality, according to many users , is that it feels a lot like ads wearing a minimalist disguise.

items.title: Stop using YouTubeâ€™s incognito mode; this trick is better
items.summary: Why watch ads when you can have your Premium perks on a second account?
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority I often come across a quick search or video that Iâ€™d rather watch in incognito on YouTube. Itâ€™s usually related to a temporary interest or research â€” planning for a trip, comparing products before a purchase, lots of work-related searches, quick current culture-related videos â€” that I donâ€™t want to be associated with my account history, so I donâ€™t get similar recommendations for months down the line. I used to resort to YouTubeâ€™s incognito mode in the app or on the web to watch these videos without leaving a trace for the pesky algorithm. A few years ago, I discovered a better and more versatile solution that gives me the separation and privacy of an incognito mode, while still keeping all the benefits and features Iâ€™m used to. Since then, I havenâ€™t opened Incognito once.

items.title: Your Samsung phone will soon make it easier to quickly adjust this key camera setting
items.summary: Samsung will let you quickly adjust a key setting in the camera app, no deep-dive needed.
items.body: Credit: Paul Jones / Android Authority TL;DR The latest Samsung One UI 8.5 beta update offers a white balance slider in the camera app. The slider isnâ€™t functional at the moment, but will let you quickly adjust white balance levels in the default photo mode. Samsung kicked off the One UI 8.5 beta program earlier this month, allowing Galaxy S25 owners to get an early look at the upcoming software. Now, it turns out that the latest beta update brings a useful slider to the camera app. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Survey suggests some readers happily pay over $55 monthly on app subscriptions
items.summary: Quite a few of you donâ€™t mind paying $50 or more a month for app subscriptions.
items.body: Subscriptions have become an increasingly integral part of our daily lives. While you may not like it, app subscription payments ensure developers a predictable stream of revenue. While I have plenty of free apps installed on my phone, I do pull out my wallet for a handful of products, especially if I require features locked behind a paywall or if I want to support the developer. I wrote about my favorite subscriptions in a previous article, but more recently, my colleague Mitja Rutnik detailed the seven products he pays for each month . His selection included the likes of Niagara Launcher, Spotify, and Gemini, but we wanted to hear your thoughts about app subscriptions.

items.title: The OnePlus Pad Go 2 is the cheap Android iPad Iâ€™ve wanted for years
items.summary: If I didn't know better, I'd have expected an Apple logo on the back.
items.body: Appleâ€™s base iPad lives in a special space. Somehow, it has become the go-to tablet against which all others are compared, and its name has become synonymous with the large-screen experience â€” on par with Kleenex and Xerox in terms of recognition. Itâ€™s dispatched would-be rivals over and over again, seemingly proving that Cupertino has the secret sauce when it comes to simple, straightforward tablets. And yet, Iâ€™ve never really loved the base iPad. Itâ€™s always felt too much like a jack of all trades but a master of none, so Iâ€™ve been waiting patiently for an Android alternative to beat Apple at its own game here in the US.

items.title: As an Android fan, hereâ€™s why the iPhone 17 was 2025â€™s most important smartphone
items.summary: Android phones have their work cut out for them.
items.body: As 2025 comes to a close, itâ€™s fair to say this past year has been a big one in the Android world . OnePlus and other brands pushed the needle forward with silicon-carbon batteries, Samsung went all-out with its foldable ambitions, and Google basically perfected its Pixel formula. In short, there were a lot of wins. But for everything that went right with Android in 2025, itâ€™s all overshadowed by Apple and the iPhone â€” specifically, the iPhone 17 .

items.title: Googleâ€™s making an annoying change to how you uninstall system app updates (Updated: Reverted back)
items.summary: It was a little harder to uninstall an update you didn't like, but Google has now restored the previous setup.
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR Google had removed the ability to uninstall updates for system apps via the Play Store. Users had to visit app settings in the settings menu to uninstall system app updates. The change appears to have been reverted, although it is unclear whether it was a bug or an intentional change in the first place. Update: December 18, 2025 (4:33 AM ET): It appears that Google has reconsidered this change and reverted it, allowing you to easily uninstall updates again. As Android Authority contributor AssembleDebug pointed out on X , once you update a pre-installed system app, the â€œUninstallâ€ button appears next to the â€œOpenâ€ button following the install, as it did previously.

items.title: Google News now reads your headlines aloud, but thereâ€™s a catch
items.summary: The Google News app is rolling out audio briefings, turning news stories into something you can press play on.
items.body: Credit: Jay Bonggolto / Android Authority TL;DR Google News is rolling out audio briefings for people whoâ€™d rather listen than read. You get a dedicated Listen tab with a proper audio player, and briefings include clear source attribution and one-tap links to full articles. Availability is region-limited for now, but you can access it by setting your region to the US. If you prefer listening to the news instead of reading it, Google is finally catering to you. The company is rolling out audio briefings in its Google News app , but youâ€™ll only get them if your region settings are correct. Google first teased this feature earlier in December , framing it as an experiment for users who prefer absorbing information by listening. Now, itâ€™s rolling out to devices.

items.title: Never mind the S26 Ultra, this eagerly anticipated Ultra phone is launching next week
items.summary: Expect a new one-inch main camera sensor and a fancy Leica-certified APO telephoto lens.
items.body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority TL;DR Xiaomi has confirmed that it will launch the Xiaomi 17 Ultra next week. This will be the first phone as part of an expanded partnership with Leica. The phone has a new one-inch camera sensor as well as a Leica-certified APO telephoto lens. The Xiaomi 15 Ultra was one of our favorite camera phones of 2025. We were expecting the Xiaomi 17 Ultra to launch in early 2026, but the company has just confirmed that the new phone will arrive next week. Xiaomi confirmed on Weibo that the Xiaomi 17 Ultra will be launched next week. This would be much earlier than recent Xiaomi Ultra phones, which have typically launched in February or March around Mobile World Congress.

items.title: Exynos 2600 specs leak: Will some Galaxy S26 models be miles behind?
items.summary: Here's what to expect from the Exynos-powered Galaxy S26 series phones.
items.body: Credit: YouTube/Samsung TL;DR A leaker has posted some specs for the Samsung Exynos 2600 processor. The new chipset is said to have a 10-core 3.9GHz CPU and an AMD GPU running at 985MHz. The Exynos 2600 is expected to be available in some Galaxy S26 and S26 Plus models. Samsung teased the arrival of the Exynos 2600 processor earlier this month, and itâ€™s expected to power the Galaxy S26 and S26 Plus in some regions. Now, a trusted leaker has posted more details about the chipset. Tipster Ice Universe claimed on Twitter that the Exynos 2600 has a 2nm design. They add that the chipset has a 10-core CPU, featuring one cluster clocked at 3.9GHz, another clocked at 3.25GHz, and a third cluster running at 2.75GHz.

items.title: Google Home app update finally makes moving devices from Nest app less painful
items.summary: Moving Nest devices to the Google Home app is now a one-tap job.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google Homeâ€™s December 10 update adds one-tap transfer for Nest devices. You can now move multiple cameras and other Nest hardware from the Nest app in one go. The feature appears to be limited to Google Home public preview users. Google has published the changelog for the December 10 Google Home app update a few days after the update itself rolled out.

items.title: Pixel 10 finally gets its long-promised GPU driver upgrade, but the real test starts now
items.summary: The update aligns with Imagination's August driver release and brings Android 16 and Vulkan 1.4 support.
items.body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority TL;DR Google has started rolling out a new GPU driver for the Pixel 10 series with Android 16 QPR3 Beta 1. The update aligns with Imaginationâ€™s August driver release and brings Android 16 and Vulkan 1.4 support. While real-world performance gains remain unconfirmed, the update should reach stable builds in a future Pixel Drop. Google is rolling out a long-awaited GPU driver update for the Pixel 10 series, following a promise made back in October . With the release of Android 16 QPR3 Beta 1 , the Pixel 10â€™s Imagination PowerVR GPU is now running a newer driver, and on paper, itâ€™s a meaningful step forward.

items.title: Google continues its desktop push by letting Android 16 QPR3 cast external displays
items.summary: You can finally cast the screen contents of an external display in the Android 16 QPR3 beta.
items.body: TL;DR Android 16 QPR3 Beta 1 now allows users to cast content directly from connected external displays. This follows a previous update in the initial Android 16 release that enabled screen recording for external monitors. Users can now select their external display within the â€œCast your screenâ€ dialog to stream its contents to other devices. As part of its efforts to bring Android to PCs with â€˜ Aluminium OS ,â€™ Google has been steadily improving how the operating system handles input peripherals, app windowing, and external displays. This includes both big changes that the majority of users expect from desktop OSes as well as smaller tweaks that only a fraction of users will appreciate. With the release of Android 16 in June, for example, Google updated the screen recorder dialog to allow you to select external displays, enabling you to record activity on them. Now with the latest beta, Google is following up by allowing you to cast screen content from external displays. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Paying for YouTube Premium? Googleâ€™s giving you 40% off the Pixel 10 series
items.summary: This might be the most killer YouTube Premium perk of the year.
items.body: TL;DR YouTube Premium subscribers are getting a limited-time offer to buy a Pixel 10 series phone at a 40% discount. Google is now emailing a discount code to YouTube Premium members. Thereâ€™s no fine print, but the offer is only valid for a few more days. YouTube Premium subscribers are getting an early Christmas present, a new perk thatâ€™s possibly one of the best YouTube has rolled out this year. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Android 16 QPR3 finally lets you see exactly which app is tracking your location
items.summary: Android 16 QPR3 adds a blue icon in the status bar that you can tap to see which apps are accessing your deviceâ€™s location.
items.body: TL;DR Android 16 QPR3 Beta 1 brings back the expandable location indicator, a feature Google previously tested in Android 13 but never released. Tapping the new blue status bar icon opens a privacy dialog that explicitly lists which apps are currently accessing your location. Previously, the system alerted you to location access but failed to identify the specific app responsible for the tracking. Google rolled out Android 16 QPR3 Beta 1 earlier today for Tensor-powered Pixel devices. While it includes expected features like flashlight brightness controls and navigation button order settings â€” changes we anticipated from recent Android Canary releases â€” it also brought a surprise: the return of the expandable location indicator in the status bar. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Hereâ€™s every new feature for Pixel phones in Android 16 QPR3 Beta 1
items.summary: The first beta of Android 16 QPR3 gives us a taste of what to expect in the March 2026 Pixel update.
items.body: The first beta for Android 16â€™s final quarterly update was just released today. Since Google didnâ€™t share a detailed changelog for Android 16 QPR3 Beta 1 , I installed it on one of my own Pixel devices to find out whatâ€™s new. Read on if youâ€™re wondering whether itâ€™s worth installing or if you just want to know whatâ€™s coming! Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Android 16â€™s final quarterly beta is here for Pixel phones
items.summary: Adventurous users can try out Android 16 QPR3 Beta 1 on their Pixel devices ahead of the stable release next March.
items.body: TL;DR Google has officially released Android 16 QPR3 Beta 1 for Tensor-powered Pixel devices. Users enrolled in the Android Beta program will automatically receive the OTA update. Installing this update keeps you on the beta channel until March 2026 unless you opt out and install the data-wiping downgrade OTA. Google has officially kicked off the beta program for its third and final quarterly platform release of Android 16 . Android 16 QPR3 Beta 1 is now available for all Tensor-powered Pixel devices, letting adventurous users try out some of the new features coming in the March 2026 Android update. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

The Apple MacBook Air M4 is $250 off right now, bringing the cost down to $749. Thatâ€™s an excellent price for such a good computer! Buy the Apple MacBook Air M4 for just $749 ($250 off)

items.title: Donâ€™t look now, but your Pixel may be getting a surprise update
items.summary: The second Pixel update this month started arriving for phones a little earlier today.
items.body: TL;DR This month, Google has already delivered the December Pixel Drop, as well as its standard monthly updates. Today, though, Pixel phones have started receiving a new, smaller, second update. Google has yet to reveal what the update addresses, but itâ€™s likely to contain a critical fix. With December more than half over, many of us have our sights solidly on whatâ€™s coming up next, with holidays and the new year just days away. But before we dive headfirst into 2026, weâ€™ve got at least one more system update arriving for Pixel phones . Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Deals: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 vs Google Pixel 10 Pro Fold
items.summary: Which foldable phone are you taking home?
items.body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority If youâ€™re looking for a foldable phone, the top contenders are definitely the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 and the Google Pixel 10 Pro Fold. Both are currently very nicely discounted, so itâ€™s a good day to finally make up your mind about one of them. Buy the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 for $1,599.99 ($400 off)

items.title: Got 16 hours to kill? Streamers subject Samsung Galaxy Z Trifold to epic endurance test
items.summary: Watch Samsung's TriFold survive 25,000 folds in this durability test marathon.
items.body: TL;DR According to Samsung, the Galaxy Z TriFoldâ€™s screen is rated for 200,000 folds, and some YouTubers are trying to test just that. Across two multi-hour streams, theyâ€™ve already clocked 25,000 open-and-close events. So far the screen has held up to the use, although thereâ€™s still a long way to go. Whatâ€™s the most desirable phone around right now? For a whole lot of reasons, smartphone fans this year have been intrigued by Samsungâ€™s Galaxy Z TriFold . Right now, itâ€™s still out of touch for most of us (we were lucky enough to score the hands-on time you can watch above) between restricted international availability, a sky-high price tag, and limited stock causing it to quickly sell out. Eventually that will change â€” will you pick one up then? If youâ€™ve been thinking at all about it, or are just curious how a screen like this phoneâ€™s holds up to repeated use, you are absolutely going to want to check out what a few South Korean YouTubers have been up to. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

Not only can I afford it, but projectors have gotten impressively accessible. For example, the Yaber Projector L2s Home Cinema is normally only $169.99, and right now you can get it for even cheaper! Buy the Yaber Projector L2s Home Cinema for just $101.98 ($68.01 off)

items.title: Android XR may not have to worry about pressure from Meta and Horizon OS, after all
items.summary: Meta hits "pause" on XR headsets from ASUS and Lenovo.
items.body: TL;DR Last year, Meta introduced Horizon OS, its new branding for Meta Quest OS. The plan was to license Horizon OS to hardware partners, with ASUS and Lenovo initially confirmed as two. Meta now says those plans are on pause as the company focuses more on its own hardware efforts. It feels like mobile tech is at an inflection point right now when it comes to all things extended reality (XR). While the idea behind glasses-based augmented reality and mixed reality has been around for years, itâ€™s only recently that the hardware and software powering these solutions have matured to the point where all this actually feels like it might just be commercially viable. As we look forward to whatâ€™s next from Google and Android XR , it sounds like Metaâ€™s own XR plans are going a bit sideways. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Sharing audio on a Google Meet call just got a lot easier
items.summary: Google Meet can now share your complete device audio while presenting, rather than only a specific tab.
items.body: TL;DR Google Meet is expanding audio presentation support during video calls on macOS and Windows. Previously, users could only share audio from the specific Chrome tab they were presenting. Google Meet can now share your system audio, allowing meeting participants to hear sound from any app or source on your computer. Google Meet is a free and simple video conferencing program, but itâ€™s not without limitations. The software supports sharing Google Chrome tabs, system windows, and even the presenterâ€™s entire screen to create a collaborative experience with meeting participants. However, Google Meet was historically less versatile when it came to sharing system audio. In an update, Google is tweaking Meet to handle audio sharing better, adding support for sharing device audio with the group. While presenting a specific app window or your computerâ€™s entire screen, Meet can now share your deviceâ€™s complete system audio with meeting participants. This makes it possible for users to play audio from an app thatâ€™s running in the background during a Meet call. Before the change, Google Meet users had to present a specific tab to share audio from a site with the group.

items.title: Android is preparing a hub for all your satellite-connected apps
items.summary: Android is adding a new page that shows you which apps support satellite connectivity.
items.body: TL;DR Google is preparing a new Quick Settings tile and dedicated menu to help users manage Androidâ€™s expanding satellite connectivity features. The menu lists compatible apps, revealing that X, Snapchat, and weather apps may soon support satellite data or calling. This feature distinguishes between different satellite connection types but is currently hidden behind a developer option in the latest Android Canary build. A few years ago, taking an Android phone into an area without cell service meant you were completely cut off â€” unable to text friends, family, or even emergency services. Today, however, you wouldnâ€™t be so disconnected thanks to satellite connectivity , a feature that links your phone directly to satellites orbiting Earth. Google introduced platform support for satellite connectivity in last yearâ€™s Android release, though the feature was initially limited to emergency messaging. The technology has advanced significantly since then, however, paving the way for features like WhatsApp calling and live location sharing even without cellular coverage.

items.title: Google AI Mode gets a speed boost with Gemini 3 Flash
items.summary: The newest Flash model is now available across Google products.
items.body: TL;DR Gemini 3 Flash is rolling out today to products including AI Mode and the Gemini app. The new model is more performant than 2.5 Pro while working faster than 2.5 Flash. The Gemini app and Googleâ€™s AI Mode should feel a little quicker starting today. Googleâ€™s announced that its latest Gemini model, Gemini 3 Flash, is now rolling out across its various AI products. As the name implies, 3 Flash is meant to be quicker than other Gemini 3 models while still offering strong performance on AI benchmarks. Google announced the rollout in a blog post this morning. The company says that Gemini 3 Flash includes the best of Gemini 3â€™s â€œPro-grade reasoningâ€ while operating with less latency and, crucially, at a lower cost, an area thatâ€™s still a sore spot for AI providers at large.

items.title: Need a security camera? The Blink Mini 2 and Outdoor 4 are at record-low prices!
items.summary: Keep an eye on your home, and your wallet.
items.body: Credit: Amazon Are you looking to get some new security cameras? Blink already offers some of the best value for the money in the market, and two of its most popular products are even cheaper right now. The Blink Mini 2 and Blink Outdoor 4 security cameras dropped to record-low prices, saving you over half the price in both cases. Buy the Blink Mini 2 for a mere $17.99 ($22 off)

items.title: Verizon is boosting its network with 4,400 additional towers, but will it make a difference?
items.summary: More towers are coming, but noticeable improvements are still uncertain.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Verizon will add access to over 4,400 Array towers (formerly US Cellular) through a new multi-year colocation agreement. The deal reflects Verizonâ€™s rent-instead-of-own strategy, following its exit from tower ownership last year, which has become the industry norm for all major US carriers. Network improvements are likely to be real but fairly incremental, with limited short-term impact for most users. Earlier this year, T-Mobile formally acquired US Cellularâ€™s customer base , retail footprint, and some of its spectrum in the process. That said, the company behind US Mobile continues as Array. Going forward, Arrayâ€™s core business is to license its massive collection of former US Cellular towers to other companies, with T-Mobile signing a deal in May to use over 2,000 of them to boost its own coverage. Now it seems Verizon is making a deal of its own , committing to the use of over 4,400 new towers in the deal. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: You can now use your Pixel Watch to track down your missing phone
items.summary: Google finally brings the Find Hub app to Wear OS smartwatches.
items.body: TL;DR Google has finally released its Find Hub app for Wear OS. Available for Pixel Watch models on the Play Store, Find Hub lets you track down your missing hardware. The app appears to also work fine when sideloaded onto other Wear OS models. Losing your stuff sucks, but that separation doesnâ€™t have to be permanent. Find Hub has been making it easier to track down missing gear, whether those are devices like wearables that natively connect to Googleâ€™s tracking network, or anything youâ€™re following with the help of an external tracker tag . But now Googleâ€™s finally flipping the script, and making it possible for you to use your wearable to track down other lost gadgets. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Need inspiration? Here are 7 last-minute gift ideas under $100 for techies
items.summary: Affordable tech gifts that wonâ€™t feel like panic buys.
items.body: Credit: Sound Guys Christmas is now uncomfortably close, and if you are still staring at a half-empty gift list, youâ€™re not alone. Tech gifts are especially tricky at this stage, with budgets tight and the techie in your life probably already well-stocked in most departments. Thatâ€™s why we have rounded up a handful of last-minute tech gift ideas that come in under $100 at current prices and donâ€™t necessarily rely on knowing someoneâ€™s exact setup. Several of these are the kind of gifts that still make sense even if the recipient already owns something similar, such as a smart light or a useful accessory they didnâ€™t realize they needed. Theyâ€™re practical, a little bit fun, and easy to slot into everyday life. And yes, a few of them would also make perfectly reasonable â€œaccidentalâ€ gifts to yourself.

items.title: The new OnePlus Pad Go 2 beats the OnePlus 15, 15R for software updates
items.summary: OnePlus's mid-range tablet is getting five years of software updates, compared to the OnePlus 15's four years.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR The OnePlus Pad Go 2 features a 12.1-inch 2.8K LCD, a MediaTek Dimensity 7300 processor, and a large 10,050mAh battery. It launches with Android 16 and promises five years of software updates, which is longer than the support for the OnePlus 15 flagships. The tablet is priced at $399.99 in the US, with pre-orders open now and general sales starting December 26, 2025. Alongside the OnePlus 15R , OnePlus is also refreshing its budget Android tablet offering with the new OnePlus Pad Go 2 , which features a larger display, a newer processor, additional software updates, and more. The OnePlus Pad Go 2 features a 12.1-inch 2.8K (2,800 x 1,980 resolution) 120Hz LCD with Dolby Vision support, offering a peak brightness of 900 nits. The display size is larger than its predecessor, but the Pad Go 2 retains the squarish 7:5 aspect ratio for a book-like layout. The tablet measures 266.01mm x 192.77mm x 6.83mm, and the Wi-Fi variant weighs 597g. There are also quad speakers on board.

items.title: Wallpaper Wednesday: More great phone wallpapers for all to share (December 17)
items.summary: Here is a weekly selection of Android wallpapers created by our readers and members of the Android Authority team!
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority Welcome to Wallpaper Wednesday! In this weekly roundup, weâ€™ll give you a handful of Android wallpapers you can download and use on your phone, tablet, or even your laptop/PC. The images will come from folks here at Android Authority as well as our readers. All are free to use and come without watermarks. File formats are JPG and PNG, and weâ€™ll provide images in both landscape and portrait modes, so theyâ€™ll be optimized for various screens. For the newest walls as well as all the ones from previous weeks, check out this Drive link . Want to submit your own? Head to the bottom of this article.

items.title: OnePlus 15R lands with near-flagship power and a massive battery
items.summary: Here is what you need to know about the phone's US availability and pre-order deals.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR The OnePlus 15R features a Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 SoC, a 165Hz AMOLED screen, and a 7,400mAh battery. It lacks a telephoto camera and LTPO display but adds IP69K ratings and an ultrasonic fingerprint sensor. Pricing starts at $699.99 with pre-orders beginning today and open sales beginning January 8, 2026. OnePlus is launching not one, but two pairs of flagships this year. At the start of the year, the much-acclaimed OnePlus 13 and OnePlus 13R were launched, but a few weeks ago, the less-acclaimed OnePlus 15 was also introduced. Rounding up the year is the new OnePlus 15R, which is now available globally alongside the OnePlus Pad Go 2 . Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?
